title: Nicolás Fernández Miranda
text:
Nicolás Fernández Miranda (born November 25, 1972 in <a href="Buenos%20Aires">Buenos Aires</a>, <a href="Argentina">Argentina</a>) is a former <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> footballer. He won over 40 <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">caps</a>, with six as captain playing at <a href="Scrum-half%20%28rugby%20union%29">scrum half</a> for the <a href="Argentina%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Argentina rugby union side</a> ("los Pumas"). He made his international test debut at the age of 21 on 28 May 1994 against the <a href="United%20States%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">United States</a>. He scored 5 tries for Argentina. He played most of his career for the <a href="Hind%C3%BA%20Club">Hindú Club</a> in Argentina. He spent the 2002 season playing for the <a href="South%20Africa">South Africa</a>n side <a href="Sharks%20%28rugby%20club%29">Sharks</a>, and the 2003 season for <a href="Petrarca%20Rugby">Petrarca</a> in Italy. He then returned to Hindú Club.
His brother is <a href="Juan%20de%20la%20Cruz%20Fern%C3%A1ndez%20Miranda">Juan de la Cruz Fernández Miranda</a>.
